description: Sum of n consecutive primes starting at a(n) is prime (or 0 if impossible).
comments: a(n) = 0 iff n is even and the sum of 2...P(n) is not prime. See A013916. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 16 2002
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
C. W. Trigg, Prime sums of consecutive primes, J. Rec. Math., 18 (No. 4, 1985-1986), 247ff.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
mathematica: f[n_] := If[OddQ@ n, Block[{k = 1}, While[ !PrimeQ[Plus @@ Prime[Range[k, k + n - 1]]], k++]; Prime@ k], If[ PrimeQ[Plus @@ Prime@ Range@ n], 2, 0]]; Array[f, 96] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 11 2015 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Robert G. Wilson v_, _Mira Bernstein_
